statements: UPDATE DataProcessingTable SET data='Updated data' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE DataProcessingTable SET timestamp=NOW(), data='Another updated data' WHERE id=2;
UPDATE DataProcessingTable SET data = 'Updated Data', timestamp = NOW() WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE DataProcessingTable SET timestamp = '2022-01-01 12:00:00', data = 'New Data' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE users SET age = 30, email = 'example1@gmail.com' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE orders SET quantity = 5, price = 50.00 WHERE order_id = 100;
UPDATE users SET username='Alice', age=30 WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE orders SET quantity=5, product_name='Book' WHERE order_id = 100;
UPDATE users SET email='john.doe@example.com' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE orders SET total_amount=50.25, order_date='2022-03-15' WHERE order_id=100;
UPDATE USERS SET email='newemail@example.com', created_at=CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, username='newUsername' WHERE user_id=123;
UPDATE orders SET total_amount=100.50, order_date='2022-07-15 10:00:00' WHERE order_id=456;
UPDATE data_records SET record_data = 'Updated data' WHERE record_id = 1;
UPDATE data_aggregates SET aggregate_value = 10.5 WHERE aggregate_id = 2;
UPDATE data_records SET record_data='Updated Data', record_date='2022-01-01 08:00:00' WHERE record_id=1;
UPDATE data_aggregates SET aggregate_value=10.5, aggregate_name='New Name' WHERE aggregate_id=2;
UPDATE users SET role = 'admin' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE orders SET total_amount = 150.75, order_date = '2022-05-20' WHERE order_id = 1001;
